definition: to migrate/to move to a new place of residence
to move/to shift/to change/to alter/to remove
to reside/to be (in a certain position)/to store up/to be at a standstill/residence/house/restaurant/classifier for bedrooms
(archaic) sentence-final particle expressing a doubting attitude
surname Ju

sentences.english: Thee lions emigrated to the western woods.
sentences.chinese: 狮群移居到西边的树林里。

sentences.english: He said that if his children were older he would emigrate.
sentences.chinese: 他说如果他的孩子们再大点的话他就会移居国外。

sentences.english: Lewis. A Mars rampant with life. A water-covered Venus populated with floating, living islands.
sentences.chinese: 水覆盖下的金星移居来一些漂泊的栖身用的“岛屿”。

sentences.english: The first evidence that ancient people had moved to Mesa Verde is from about the year five hundred.
sentences.chinese: 古人移居到梅沙而第的第一个证据来自公元五百年。

sentences.english: Most of the residents of Li Wen Island are the migrants coming from the northeastern regions.
sentences.chinese: 礼文岛的居民大部分都是来自于东北地区的移居者。

sentences.english: After the destruction of Varl, the Hutts migrated to other worlds.
sentences.chinese: 瓦尔毁灭之后，赫特人移居其他星球。

sentences.english: Facusse says Honduras can count for help on its expatriots living in the United States.
sentences.chinese: 法库赛说，洪都拉斯可以依靠移居美国的同胞的帮助。

sentences.english: The government neglects us here [in the neighbourhood]. It is deemed to be an illegal settlement.
sentences.chinese: 政府完全漠视我们在这里生活，视我们为非法移居者。

sentences.english: If you want a tan, move to Florida.
sentences.chinese: 如果你想晒黑，移居弗罗里达吧。

sentences.english: You mentioned in your letter that you might be moving abroad.
sentences.chinese: 你在你的信里提到你可能要移居国外。

sentences.english: I could see why millions of people were choosing to migrate there.
sentences.chinese: 我能理解为什么数百万人会选择移居这里。

sentences.english: After graduating from NYU Endodontics, Dr. Berlin moved to Florida.
sentences.chinese: 从纽约大学毕业后，他移居佛罗里达。

sentences.english: She expatriated herself for years at New York.
By 1949, Lessing had moved to London with her young son.
sentences.chinese: 1949年的时候，莱辛已经携幼子移居伦敦。

sentences.english: A water-covered Venus populated with floating, living "islands."
sentences.chinese: 水覆盖下的金星移居来一些漂浮的居住用的“岛屿”。

sentences.english: Then he moved to another state. And I moved to another city.
sentences.chinese: 他搬到了另外一个州，我也移居另一个城市。

definition: to settle (in some city, country etc)/to take up residence
to move (from one residence to another)
the whole family
to live far away from one's native place/to reside in a foreign country
to immigrate/to migrate/emigrant/immigrant
ancestral home (town)/birthplace
ancestral hometown/original domicile (and civil registration)
to move in (to new lodging)
to move/to shift/to change (a position or location etc)/to promote
to reside/to dwell/to live in a place/resident in
to live in seclusion
stable household, established profession (idiom); settled and comfortably off
to move away/to change residence
to make one's home in a place/to settle
to become naturalized/to become a citizen
accompanied by one's dependents/encumbered by wife and children
